labels.analysis: The MCP Server "Pump Token Manager" is designed to create and manage Solana tokens specifically on the Pump.fun platform. It provides tools for token creation, buying, selling, and balance inquiry, all integrated with Claude and securely managed through private keys. The functionality is geared toward Solana-based token operations, making it a niche tool within the cryptocurrency and blockchain space.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Cryptocurrency & Blockchain" is chosen because the server's core functionality revolves around creating, buying, and selling tokens on the Solana blockchain. The tools explicitly address token management and balance queries, which are central to blockchain and crypto operations. The secondary label "Operating System" is relevant due to the server's ability to manage keys and list accounts, which involves local file and account operations. No custom label is needed as the predefined categories cover the primary functionality well.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: Pump Token Manager
server_info_crawled.author: @dinfroy/dinfroyp
server_info_crawled.overview: Create and manage Solana tokens on Pump.fun seamlessly integrated with Claude. Perform token creation, buying, selling, and balance inquiries through simple commands. Deploy easily on Smithery.ai or run locally with secure private key management.

tools.name: get-token-info
tools.description: Deploy Server Pump Token Manager @dinfroy/dinfroyp Try in Playground get-token-info

tools.name: list-accounts

tools.name: get-account-balance
tools.description: Get the SOL and token balances for an account

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@dinfroy/dinfroyp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
